title: The Incentive
description: Under pressure from Robert to increase branch sales, Andy offers an incentive program to the sales staff, which backfires on him when he offers a very personal grand prize.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, so this isn't matching up with this...and I'm not sure which one's right. Can you just hunt down the original for me?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes. Me do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey Kev, what were you saying before about the paperwork?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Me do it now.  Go.  Stop worry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kevin, do you feel OK?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Me feel good.  Body strong.  Sleep big last night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I think we should get him to the hospital.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, alright Kev why don't you come with us?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, guys.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, he's fine.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He's fine.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He's always been like that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No he hasn't.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I mean, he's gotten worse over the years....

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He's making a statement. It's an ironic comment on our expectations of him.  A funhouse image of our model of Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You keep think that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Me mechanic not speak English. But he know what me mean when me say "car no go", and we best friends.  So me think: why waste time, say lot word when few word do trick?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Kevin, I appreciate what you're trying to do.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Here, we have a word code, the same way we have a dress code.  And what we're talking about is...basically the speech equivalent... to just wearing underpants.  Sometimes words, you no need use...but need need for talk talk.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But save time. More success.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Does it save time though? 'Cause we've been here for about an hour.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No me fault.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kevin, at most you're saving a microscopic amount of time.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Many small time make big time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you gonna do with all this time?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: See world.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kevin, you cannot possibly save enough time to see the world.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: K, Kevin, are you saying "See the world"? or "Sea World?"

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: See world.  Oceans. Fish.  Jump. China.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, see? Right there, that's the problem with your method. 'Cause I still don't know if you're saying "Sea World" or "see the world," and it's taking a lot of time to explain it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Fine, fine.  I'll talk normally.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: When me President, they see. [Nodding and smiling]  They see.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This week we are rolling out the brand new Sabre tablet....the Pyramid.  [holds up triangle shaped touch pad]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ooh, why is it shaped like that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, you can tell your clients: "Unleash the power of the pyramid."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's huge.  How much does it weigh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no no no.  Without the battery pack and optional memory booster, it's barely three pounds.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: How much memory does it have without the booster?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fifty L.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm sorry," L"?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How many L to a K?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're really going to want the booster.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How on earth are we supposed to sell...?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll take five.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Andy walks in with ties on his arm]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Andy, don't make us sell this stupid thing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, no no no no no. This is Dwight's meeting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just wanted to pop in and get your opinions on ties...and tie clips.  Which combo do you think Robert is going to like more? [To Oscar] What do you think, C-SPAN?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: ..."C-SPAN"?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.  C-SPAN, cocker spaniel.  Spaniel because of your Spanish bloodline and cocker cause......

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is this really the best use of our collective time?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am still forming a first impression with Robert.  Once it is formed, we can all relax.  Ok, I'm sorry to hijack your meeting , D dub dog...had to pull rank.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to group] OK, let's look at some ties.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here's how I'm going to help out from now on. I'm going to not care, and I'm going to sit around quietly waiting for Andy's inevitable demise.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [To Oscar] Your friend Neil Patrick Harris really made me laugh the other night.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Um, D-Dog, you have a message.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Erin, you don't need to call him that.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy wants us to, P-Dog.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's ok E-Dog, just who called?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Justine.  She said she's coming by later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Your ex-wife?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait, I thought she was a **** and you ******* hated her guts?

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Group murmurs, offended]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No no no no.  I like her.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well I'm just quoting you.  I would never say that about her.  I don't know the woman.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nah man, we get along now.  Real well.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. Alright. Can't wait to meet her.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll introduce you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, we had a few fights, I suppose.  But last night we put a lot of that to bed.  I can't tell you what I did with my ex wife last night.... I have to sing it.  [singing] We took a shower, we were naked. We ska dap dap doo doo doo doo doo doo doo.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to Robert California] Hi Dad!...... Ahhh....oh boy.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Hello, Andy.  Excellent tie.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Would you be requiring a cold beverage while you're here?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'd love some coffee.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I was looking over your projections, and I think we can do better.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you factoring in the... whole national ...economy.... declining and all that?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, do you know why I chose you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I think I can sum it up with what I think is your favorite ice cream flavor....vanilla?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Vanilla? No no no no.  You'll never guess in a million billion years you'll never guess.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You were saying you chose me.... There was a reason?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, can you inspire? Do you have that skill set?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can I inspire? [laughs] I don't know!.....I don't know.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Erin enters with overflowing cup of coffee]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oh! Thank you. Uh....

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, sorry.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You can just put it down.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Erin sets cup down and Robert sips it]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: That is very cold.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.  It's old. [smiling]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Why would I.....?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I asked if you wanted a cold beverage and you said "coffee"....

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why don't we get Robert a nice hot fresh cup and I will have this.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy, you don't want that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I've been craving a freezing cup of old coffee. [sips] Mmm....

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You like her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: She likes you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, we've both been into each other at different times and just never really synced up.  Now we're in this weird dance....

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [interrupting] I'm afraid you've lost my interest.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Let me call you back.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I gotta go.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: If the office superstore was supposed to put us little suppliers out of business, why are we still here?

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Kevin Raises hand]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Ah...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This is where we go

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [chuckling] Oh, you'd go someplace else.  That's not it, that's not the answer.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It's a answer.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's a wrong answer.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: There are no wrong answers.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Take a look at where you are, where you once worked in a dying industry, you now work at it's birth.  Those superstores are terrified of us.  Anybody know why?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Wait....they're terrified?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Let me tell you how I buy something these days.  I know what I want I go on the internet, I get the best price.  Or I don't know what I want and I go to a small store that can help me.  The era of personal service is back. You are back.  You'll find that customers will pay our higher prices and then they will thank us, and we will say to them "you are welcome." [Applause] Andrew, I chose you for a reason. Lead these people.  Show me the best numbers this place has ever seen.  Last quarter we saw 4% growth. Double it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You got it.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Double.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Done.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'm not kidding.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Neither am I, it's already done.  Hah, I'm just kidding, it's going to take some time.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Double.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Andy knocks on Jim's desk]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. [Andy pushes things aside and sits on top of Jim's desk, kicking things in the process.]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's up, guys? Just thought we'd have a little rap session, talk about business...see how things are going? Ahem...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why don't you start?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If no one else wants to? I was just thinking about Robert...man.  What a boss.  Just throws down goals, you know? Anyway, how's the sales doubling ...project going?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, how are we supposed to do that? We can't just press a magic button.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OF course not.  There's no magic button.  You have to summon that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: If we could just double our sales, we already would have.  You're not making any sense.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He brings up two good points.  Do you have any new leads? Any new territories you want us to look into? Maybe have an in with a big client that we can get our foot in the door?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight, anything?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We could talk about how fast children grow up, and before you know it they're out of the house.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know what? We need to get our heads out of the box.  If we did have something, what would it look like, what would it be? [Jim raises hand] Tuna.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: New leads, a new territory to look into, maybe an in with a big company that we could get our foot in the door...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fart..... good Sesh. [gets up] That leg's asleep.

quotes.speaker: Justine
quotes.text: Hello. I'm looking for Darryl Philbin?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Don't! oh, you must think...I'm not. I'm using the fax, this isn't, no wait.  I'm not supposed to represent the company. Right? There's usually an Erin here.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So...DARRYL! A GIRL!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [Singing] rub a dub dub...I got scrubbed.  'Sup, darlin'? Everybody, this is Justine. [murmurs of hello from the group] This is Jim and Oscar, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Justine
quotes.text: Can we.... go some place private?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Follow me, I got a space. After you.  I've been thinking about you all mornin'.  I don't know what you did, I can barely walk today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: D-Bone. There you are.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me guess, somebody needs a brownie...?  Lick the spoon?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, that's ok. Just, I want, I wanted to ask you about...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is this about the profits? Because if it is I just don't see the point. It's so Wall Street.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know, right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah...um, how is everything?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. Really really good.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Must be a tough time to be a family farm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, it is. And beets are not immune.  We made some inroads in salads, but heirloom tomatoes are pushing back.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oof.  What are you gonna do about that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know, what do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There's gotta be some way you can double your beet sales...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wanted the job, the job is yours.  Just do the job! [Licks brownie battered finger] And I'll do mine..... walnuts?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Have you seen this? [Hands Pam Parenting magazine]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Parenting? Yeah. This is Cici's favorite magazine. She loves the pictures of babies.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She looks at it when she's on the potty, and she makes the faces.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Have you read it? Has an adult member of your family read this particular issue?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I flipped through it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: So you saw the article on the importance of taking frequent walks while you're pregnant?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We know that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I will be taking a morning walk and an afternoon walk.  Would you like to join me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That sounds nice.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Great.[Angela walks away]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You have a walking buddy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thanks for coming in guys.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You don't have to thank us for coming in, it's our job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well I never got thanked for coming into a meeting and I always wanted to be so I'm gonna thank people.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What's with the blanket?

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Andy removes blanket over table to reveal various items]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is what's under the blanket.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We don't get it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: These are incentives.  It's how we're gonna double growth. Now, you're probably all asking yourselves: "Well, how does this work?"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Seems like a basic reward system where you give us points, and then we redeem those points for prizes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're exactly right and you get a point.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. [smiling]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, is that a vibrator?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Twenty points.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: How does one get a point?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I've outlined the exact parameters in an email, so check your spam folders, but basically you do your job better, you get points. So, collect fifteen points and redeem them for this polar bear.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why is it all kid stuff and a vibrator? It's so gross.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There's lots of stuff.  John Irving, collected works, Twenty-two points. Or, you can pool your points and redeem fifty-five for this maternity shirt.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How 'bout you want us to work harder, pay us more.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can't.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This point system is really insulting.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ooh I didn't mean to offend you, and I hope you'll forgive me because I am very very... Sari. [tosses yellow print material over shoulder] Sixteen points.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That's a tablecloth.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What if we went all the way up to five hundred points?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's a crazy amount of points.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But, what if?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, what do you want?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know, for such a crazy number I'd like something pretty crazy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright. For five hundred points, I will wear a dress to work. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's pretty good.  What about uh, for a thousand points?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'll run naked through the parking lot with a donut on my ding-dong. [laughter] Yeah? You like that? Alright! For five thousand points, I will let you tattoo whatever you want on the stern of the old SS Bernard![Andy points to his rear-end]

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Ooooh!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, alright. And you are totally serious?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Swear to God, hope to die. Now let's get to work!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait. You did say we could pool our points, right? In that case...let's get to work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah! Whoo! [Group cheers]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on the phone]I can have it to you by the beginning of next week.  Alright? Thanks very much. [hangs up] Uh, Phyllis! Bracken Auto?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [hands Jim folder] Ask for Donald, Karen's bananas.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: T-bag bone...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andrew.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Have you noticed a little bit of a mood shift around here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I didn't notice anything.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really? Because I sat next to Stanley for years....and this is nap time. Open eye nap time. He balances the phone on his shoulder and just powers down.  Now look at him.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [On the phone] You've got to unleash the power of the Pyramid!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know what to tell you, man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You think it has something to do with that incentive program?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, one hundred percent.  We all want to see you tattoo your ass.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Bah...I think people thought I was kidding when I said that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nah, you definitely weren't kidding.  And that came across loud and clear. Oh, by the way, I want to hand this in. [hands Andy slip of paper]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hundred and twenty points.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Big sale. Don't worry about it though, I don't really care about the points.  I would like a point receipt though...[on phone] Hey! Yes, this is Jim Halpert calling for Donald...can you hold on for one second? Thank you very much. [gets up to give Erin his point receipt]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Who talked to Maggie at Kaufman's?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes! [adds receipt to growing pile and thumbs up Andy.]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on the phone]and I'm back. How are you sir?....I think we can squeeze a couple more golf games in, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Where's Angela? [Hands paper over her shoulder]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Kevin, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Don't talk to me! [Everyone continues to work busily]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on phone] Hi, Professor Frank, Andy Bernard, class of '95. Hey there, um, I'm a huge fan of your management book, Management. Um, quick question.  I may be missing a chapter here...De-Incentivizing. What are your strategies? Looking for a real blow to morale...uh why? Well, um I guess you could say I'm in one of those classic ass tattoo incentive situations. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Erin fills in drawing showing points, crowd cheers and claps]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Took 'em one day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ready! [flips sketch pad showing tattoo possibilities] "I'm not as think as you drunk I am!" [crowd claps and cheers]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I like it, I like it! [Pam flips the page]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do Not Resuscitate...[mild cheering]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK, keep in mind, it's not too late to choose another prize and there are some great new additions.  My car [nervous laughter] for a thousand points....or best offer.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What else you got?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, and then this was Phyllis's idea...[shocked cheers] So nasty Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We were hoping you could do something like this...

quotes.speaker: Tattoo Artist
quotes.text: So, coming out of his butt is a...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Baby.

quotes.speaker: Tattoo Artist
quotes.text: Baby...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Tattoo Artist
quotes.text: Yeah, no problem.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We should think about this...does anyone have any better ideas?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I like what we have.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Looks good.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: For sure.  [murmurs from group in agreement]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just need a second outside.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Gettin' psyched up?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, nobody really expects you to go through with this...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tunes..what am I doing here? Why did Robert pick me? ....Confession: I don't know what I'm doing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean, do you like it? You having fun? [Andy snorts, unsure how to answer] Tell you this, everybody else is having a lot of fun....and you did that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My ass is only so big, I mean I can't do this everyday.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But I think it's big enough to buy you some time till your next great idea....which, by the way, I can't wait for.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No one expects me to go through with this, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's ink...my stink! [crowd cheers]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My heart belongs to music. But my ass belongs to these people.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Andy removes his pants]

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [lying on table] Do your worst!

quotes.speaker: Tattoo Artist
quotes.text: Uh, you can keep your pants on actually...if just drop 'em down a bit, that'd be great.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They are already off, my good sir.

quotes.speaker: Tattoo Artist
quotes.text: I'd really prefer they not be down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I think down's better.  Sweating pretty heavily down there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you think you could work from this? [showing Tattoo artist sketch pad] we made some small adjustments.

quotes.speaker: Tattoo Artist
quotes.text: OK, you want me to...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just a few adjustments

quotes.speaker: Tattoo Artist
quotes.text: Alright, let's begin.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is where I grin and be-YOW OW!

quotes.speaker: Tattoo Artist
quotes.text: That was just the cotton swab.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Invest in softer cotton, sir. [tattooing begins] OW! Oh! Oooh! [Crowd cheers] oh, whoa!!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Obviously you can go the ass tattoo route and obviously, I'm gonna like it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: DRAW SOME BLOOD!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: AHHHHH!!!!!!!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Why did I choose Andy to run the office? Because he's all surface, uncomplicated. What you see is what you get. Could be a recipe for mediocrity, yes, but then again, it might just be why people fight for him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [removes tape to reveal tattoo of puppy] It's a Nard Dog! [group cheers] That's my nickity-name! I love it, I love it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pull up your pants.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: There's something about an underdog that really inspires...the unexceptional.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, what should we talk about?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, we could talk about an ethical dilemma I'm having.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh yeah, sure. Um, I hope I can help.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: A coworker of mine is drinking caffeine while pregnant, and I don't know if I should call social services about it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela, that's pretty transparently me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Maybe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know it's just herbal tea.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: In mugs with trace amounts of coffee!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I think you should call social services.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I already did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, maybe we should just have our own pregnancies and not pretend like we're in this together.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: When you're a kid, you picture a pilot kinda like this [imitates plane noises while steering wildly] But then you learn that's crashing the plane. The right way to do it is more like this. [calmly pulls imaginary steering back and forth] Or better yet, like this. [takes hands off imaginary wheel] Now that I'm manager, I think about that a lot. I let Dwight run the meetings, I let good people do good work and I stay out of the way.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Which combo do you think Robert's gonna like better?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Just wear one of your bowties.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No! I mean, let him, he should just explore other options...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Bowties, no offense, are a black thing. They're for rappers and NBA players. I cringe when I see Tucker Carlson trying to pull off a bowtie. It's like yeah Tucker, you're so street.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is combo number seven.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.text: Hmm, no.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't like that clip.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're right, you're right, you're right. Uh! It's so hard to find an occasion for this clip.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'd hang on to it though, cause I can think of a bunch. Like a 70's theme party, or a 70's theme meeting, or a 70's theme convention...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thanks T-Dog.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: T-Dog?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I thought I was T-Dog.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope, he means tuna dog.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuna dog!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I thought the plane was flying pretty well on auto-pilot. And then Robert California ran into the cockpit with a gun and he was like "Fly this plane to Cuba, and on the way bomb Texas" Well I don't know how to get there. Or even how to fly, even. And I don't have any bombs.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey. Maybe it'd help to just talk it over. Over a cup of cool old tea.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [sighs] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What if you were to just start with your ideas about how to double profits. Just say them all and maybe one of them will rise to the top.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't have any ideas though.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well I have an idea.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You do?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What if Dunder Mifflin were to take on 15-20 foster kids? You'd get huge checks from the government and honestly they would be ecstatic to live in the warehouse. It would be like Hogwart's.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah....I don't think that's legal. It's a nice thought though. [Erin hands Andy a gift] What is this?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I just wanted to say congratulations on your new job, officially.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You didn't have to do that. [opens box to reveal red mouse cat toy attached to key chain]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I saw it at the checkout counter, it made me think of you. I don't know why. I made it into a key chain.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're the only person who's congratulated me.
